page.title: 14SMEATHARPE - LOCAL ISSUES
page.content: Smeatharpe Village School was closed amid protest from parents. The child- ren were then transported the 3 miles to Upottery Primary School by free minibus. In 1984 the local education authority decided that children over the age of 8 would have to pay. It is now Â£2O per child per term. Parents feel this is blackmail as the road is too dangerous to walk. It is unlit, has no pavement, is sparsely populated and carries cars and heavy lorries. In September, l985 the staff at Upottery School will be reduced from 4 to 3 full-time teachers, due to falling rolls. It is a constant source of concern that this reduction in children will continue so that the teaching staff will again be cut or that the school will eventually close altogether.-
